Package care.eka.abdm

Class Profile

java.lang.Object
care.eka.abdm.Profile
public class Profile extends Object
Client for interacting with ABDM Profile APIs.

  • Constructor Details

    • Profile

      public Profile(EkaCareClient client)
      Create a new Profile instance.
      Parameters:
      client - The EkaCare client

  • Method Details

    • getProfile

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getProfile() throws IOException
      Fetch the ABHA profile of the user.
      Returns:
      ABHA profile details
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 JsonNode profile = client.getAbdmProfile().getProfile();
 System.out.println(profile.get("abha_address").asText());

    • updateProfile

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode updateProfile(Map<String,Object> profileData) throws IOException
      Update the ABHA profile.
      Parameters:
      profileData - Profile data to update
      Returns:
      Response indicating success
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Note: Fields like first_name, gender, date_of_birth cannot be modified for Aadhaar-based KYC verified profiles. Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 Map<String, Object> profileData = new HashMap<>();
 profileData.put("address", "123 Main St");
 profileData.put("pincode", "110001");
 client.getAbdmProfile().updateProfile(profileData);

    • deleteProfile

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode deleteProfile() throws IOException
      Delete the ABHA profile.
      Returns:
      Response indicating success
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Warning: This permanently removes the ABHA profile with all associated documents and records. Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 client.getAbdmProfile().deleteProfile();

    • getAbhaCard

      public byte[] getAbhaCard() throws IOException
      Get the ABHA card as an image.
      Returns:
      PNG image data of the ABHA card
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 byte[] cardImage = client.getAbdmProfile().getAbhaCard();
 Files.write(Paths.get("abha_card.png"), cardImage);

    • getAbhaQrCode

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getAbhaQrCode(String format) throws IOException
      Get the data for ABHA QR code display.
      Parameters:
      format - Response format (currently only "json" is supported)
      Returns:
      QR code data
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 JsonNode qrData = client.getAbdmProfile().getAbhaQrCode("json");
 // Use qrData to generate a QR code image

    • initiateKyc

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode initiateKyc(String method, String identifier) throws IOException
      Initiate the KYC process.
      Parameters:
      method - KYC method ("abha-number" or "aadhaar")
      identifier - ABHA number or Aadhaar number
      Returns:
      Response containing transaction ID
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 JsonNode response = client.getAbdmProfile().initiateKyc("abha-number", "1234-5678-9012");
 String txnId = response.get("txn_id").asText();

    • verifyKycOtp

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode verifyKycOtp(String txnId, String otp) throws IOException
      Verify OTP for KYC.
      Parameters:
      txnId - Transaction ID from initiateKyc
      otp - OTP received
      Returns:
      Response indicating success
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 client.getAbdmProfile().verifyKycOtp("transaction123", "123456");

    • resendKycOtp

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode resendKycOtp(String txnId) throws IOException
      Resend OTP for KYC.
      Parameters:
      txnId - Transaction ID from initiateKyc
      Returns:
      Response containing the new transaction ID
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during the request Example: 
       EkaCareClient client = new EkaCareClient("your_id", "your_secret", "user_token");
 JsonNode response = client.getAbdmProfile().resendKycOtp("transaction123");
 String newTxnId = response.get("txn_id").asText();
